info.name: Cavernous sinus
info.description: The cavernous sinuses are located on either side of the sella turcica on the upper part of the sphenoid bone.  They consist of a venous plexus of thin-walled, interconnected veins.  There is communication between the two cavernous sinuses via the intercavernous sinuses.  Many functionally-important structures pass through the cavernous sinuses including the internal carotid artery, cranial nerves III, IV, V and VI.
